active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the ethical implications of email spoofing via injection in penetration testing versus real-world phishing campaigns. How does understanding this vulnerability aid in defending against Business Email Compromise (BEC)? Provide examples from the pentesting workflow (Input Validation → Mail Injection → Spoofing → Exploitation).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards for the topic 'Email Spoofing via Injection' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Web Application Penetration Testing > 009_Input Validation Testing > Mail Injection > Email Spoofing via Injection). Consensus: 87.1% approval from 7 voters. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste the learning_objectives array here] - Active Learning: Use for contextual hints in explanations. - Scaffolding: Distribute flashcards: 6 Layer 1, 6 Layer 2, 7 Layer 3, 6 Layer 4. - Research Context: Focus on CRLF injection via vulnerable web forms (e.g., contact forms), SMTP headers, tools (Swaks, Burp, Telnet), risks (phishing, BEC, credential theft), mitigations (SPF/DKIM/DMARC). Sources: OWASP Testing Guide (https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/), PortSwigger Academy (https://portswigger.net/web-security/email-header-injection), Swaks docs (https://www.jetmore.org/john/code/swaks/). - Big Picture: Pentesting workflow role; Prior Knowledge: SMTP, SQLi/XSS. - Concept Map: Central: Email Spoofing; Branches: Injection Methods, SMTP Weaknesses, Risks, Mitigations. Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: Mix basic (8), cloze (8), multiple-choice (9). Ensure active recall, no hints on front. Explanations: 2-4 sentences, tie to Bloom's/objectives/layers, include practical example/payload. Distractors per protocol. Output ONLY as JSON array of flashcards: [{'type': 'basic|cloze|mc', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'layer': 1-4, 'blooms_level': 'Remember|etc', 'explanation': '...'}]. No extra text.
